original: Boberg, Johan Paul, arkitekt, Växjö, f. 14/8/84 i Brunskog, Värml. 1., av Magnus B. o. Charlotta Persson. G. 27 m. Hedvig Rudelius. Barn: Jan-Arne f. 29, Birgitta 34, Ingegerd 37. — Stud. v. Tekn. sk. i Sthlm 04, HKS 05, teckn :lär :ex. 08. Stud:res. t. Tyskl. o. Engl. 08, t. Tyskl. 22. Lär. v. byggn :yrkessk. 07-09, vik. lär. v. Kungsholmens h. a. 1. i Sthlm 07-08, teckn :lär. v. Växjö h. a. 1. sed. 09. Arkit :verksamh. sed. 09, utf. ritn. t. ett stort antal ensk. o. offentl. byggn., handhaft o. ordn. ett flertal utställn. Riksantikv. ombud, förest, f. Smål. mus. i Växjö 25-40, led. av styr. f. Kronob. läns hemslöjdsfören., styr. i. Skand. bankens avdrkont., stads-fullm., drätselkamm., brandstyr., bygg-n:ndn, ordf. i styr. f. System A-B i Växjö 39, verkst. dir. i Växjö Teater A-B. RNO, RVO, ProPGM, Patrst-GM, Sv. Skidförb. SM, KorrespHA.
translated: Boberg, Johan Paul, architect, born on August 14th, 1884 in Brunskog, Värmland. Son of Magnus B. and Charlotta Persson. Married Hedvig Rudelius in 1927. Children: Jan-Arne (born in 1929), Birgitta (born in 1934), Ingegerd (born in 1937). Studied at the Technical School in Stockholm from 1904 to 1905, then at the Royal Academy of Fine Arts from 1905 to 1908. Took study trips to Germany and England in 1908 and to Germany again in 1922. Taught at the Building Trades School from 1907 to 1909, as a temporary teacher at Kungsholmens High School in Stockholm from 1907 to 1908, then as a drawing teacher at Växjö High School since 1909. Has been active as an architect since 1909, designing a large number of private and public buildings, and organizing several exhibitions. Appointed representative of the National Antiquities Board, director of the Småland Museum in Växjö from 1925 to 1940, board member of the Kronoberg County Home Craft Association, board member of the Skandinaviska Bankens Avdragskonto, member of the City Council, member of the City Finance Committee, member of the Fire Brigade Board, member of the Building Committee, chairman of the board of System A-B in Växjö in 1939, and managing director of Växjö Teater A-B. Awarded the Royal Order of the North Star, the Royal Order of Vasa, the Pro Patria Gold Medal, the Patriotic Association's Large Gold Medal, the Swedish Skiing Federation's Gold Medal, and the Corresponding Member of the Finnish Society of Architects and Engineers.

structured.name: Johan Paul Boberg
structured.description: Johan Paul Boberg was a Swedish architect born on August 14th, 1884 and active since 1909. He designed a large number of private and public buildings, and organized several exhibitions. Boberg was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star, the Royal Order of Vasa, the Pro Patria Gold Medal, the Patriotic Association's Large Gold Medal, the Swedish Skiing Federation's Gold Medal, and the Corresponding Member of the Finnish Society of Architects and Engineers.
